results.title: Up a tree
results.brief_description: Donald the lumberjack decides to saw down the tree in which Chip ‘n’ Dale live. A whirlwind of comedy ensues as the chipmunks proceed to deter the determined duck in any way they can.

results.title: Up
results.brief_description: A beautifully photographed non-narrated depiction of a hang glider’s majestic flight through the Rocky Mountains, Sierra Nevada and Alaskan mountain peaks - whose journey sees him pick up a young hitchiker, but fateful end is witnessed solely by a lone eagle. Winner of Academy Award for Live Action Short Film.

results.title: Unzipped
results.creator_credit: Hachette Fillpacchi Productions, Michael Alden and Douglas Keeve
results.brief_description: Isaac Mizrahi is a talented New York fashion designer, who, after receiving negative reviews for his 1994 Spring collection, is in need of a successful season. This documentary tracks the evolution of Mizrahi’s next collection - from fledging moments of inspiration to final parade. “Unzipped” is a frank examination of the fashion industry at work - the superficiality, demands, personalities, exhaustion, frustrations, setbacks, camaraderie and creativity of it all. Supermodels take centre stage and the precociousness of this elite group is in evident abundance. Mizrahi seeks guidance from a diverse range of sources (including a ouija board) as he aims to evoke the look and style of an Inuit, mixed with 1950s cheesecake aesthetic, meets Mary Tyler Moore. Mizrahi’s mother is interviewed and gives insights into her son’s precocious talent, recognised and nurtured by her. Directed by Douglas Keeve, “Unzipped” is a candid examination of the sparks that fly when creative urges seek to ally financial interest. Features appearances from Naomi Campbell, Linda Evangelista, Cindy Crawford, Helena Christensen, Richard Gere, Eartha Kitt, Sandra Bernhard and Kate Moss. Winner of the Audience Award at the 1995 Sundance Film Festival.

results.title: Unusual artists
results.brief_description: Extraordinary painter: Earl Bailly, a Nova Scotia artist, holds the brush with his teeth. Sculptures in ice: Montreal chefs chip and chisel to see who can carve the prize-winning sculpture from a block of ice. Portraits in wool: Elizabeth Lefort keeps alive an ancient Acadian craft, creating beautiful tapestries.

results.title: Untold desires
results.creator_credit: SBS-TV, Film Victoria, AFI [au], Eva Orner and Sarah Stephens
results.brief_description: ‘Untold desires’ highlights the struggle that people with disabilities face in their quest to be recognised as sexual beings, free to express their sexuality and lead sexually active lives. Sexuality is often a private matter, and in the case of people with disabilities, sensitive too, something which the wider community would prefer not to acknowledge. In this candid documentary featuring people with disabilities, they reveal that their sexual needs are often subverted by the conservative values of those who provide essential care. ‘Untold desires’ gives voice to the issues that are important to them: choice, privacy, the right to have sexual relationships and the right to have children. They speak frankly about their search for sexually fulfilled lives and the experiences they have gained. Their honesty is both dramatic and moving and contributes to deconstructing the stereotypes that render disabled people non-sexual or perverse in the eyes of the non-disabled world. Produced with the assistance of SBS television and Film Victoria.

results.title: Untitled: five Australian artists
results.brief_description: The work of five contemporary Australian sculptors - Tony Trembath, Ian Bracegirdle, Ross Grounds, Paul Stevenson-Ryan and Ray Woolard. The sculptors talk about their avant-garde sculptures, and see them as reflections on today’s society. They cite ecology, conservation and preserving the past as being important motivators in their work, and see their art as a way of living out their fantasies
